oneandone-datasource-instance-size.body:
resource "oneandone_instance_size" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) Number of cores per processor
    name = ""

    # ram - (Optional) Size of ram in GB
    ram = ""

    # vcores - (Optional)  Number of vcores
    vcores = ""

    # id - (Optional) (Computed) The ID of the instance type
    id = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Computed) The Name of the instance type
    name = ""

    # ram - (Optional) (Computed) The size of the ram in GB
    ram = ""

    # vcores - (Optional) (Computed) The number of vcores
    vcores = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
oneandone-datasource-instance-size.description: Fetches a predefined instance type for 1&1 servers

oneandone-resource-block-storage.body:
resource "oneandone_block_storage" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) Size of the block storage (`min: 20, max: 500, multipleOf: 10`)
    size = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage
    name = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter, where the block storage will be created. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the block storage
    description = ""

    # server_id - (Optional) ID of the server that the block storage will be attached to
    server_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-firewall-policy.body:
resource "oneandone_firewall_policy" "$1" {
    # protocol - (Required)  The protocol for the rule. Allowed values are `TCP`, `UDP`, `TCP/UDP`, `ICMP` and `IPSEC`.
    protocol = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the VPN.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the VPN
    description = ""

    # port_from - (Optional)   Defines the start range of the allowed port
    port_from = ""

    # port_to - (Optional)   Defines the end range of the allowed port
    port_to = ""

    # source_ip - (Optional)   Only traffic directed to the respective IP address
    source_ip = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-image.body:
resource "oneandone_image" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the image.
    name = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Country code of the datacenter where the image will be created (`US`, `DE`, `GB`, and `ES`).
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) Image description.
    description = ""

    # frequency - (Optional) Creation policy frequency. Frecuency policy is only allowed in default datacenter. (`ONCE`, `DAILY`, `WEEKLY`)
    frequency = ""

    # num_images - (Optional) Maximum number of images. Required when image is created with frequency policy.
    num_images = ""

    # os_id - (Optional) ID of the Operating System to import.
    os_id = ""

    # server_id - (Optional) Server ID - Required when image `source` is `server`.
    server_id = ""

    # source - (Optional) Source of the new image: `server` (from an existing server), `image` (from an imported image) or `iso` (from an imported iso).
    source = ""

    # type - (Optional) Type of the ISO to import: `os` (Operating System) or `app` (Application). It is required when the source is iso.
    type = ""

    # url - (Optional) URL where the image can be downloaded. It is required when the source is image or iso.
    url = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-loadbalancer.body:
resource "oneandone_loadbalancer" "$1" {
    # source_ip - (Required) 
    source_ip = ""

    # port_server - (Required) 
    port_server = ""

    # port_balancer - (Required) 
    port_balancer = ""

    # protocol - (Required)  The protocol for the rule. Allowed values are `TCP`, `UDP`, `TCP/UDP`, `ICMP` and `IPSEC`.
    protocol = ""

    # method - (Required)  Balancing procedure Can be `ROUND_ROBIN` or `LEAST_CONNECTIONS`
    method = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the load balancer.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the load balancer
    description = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`
    datacenter = ""

    # persistence - (Optional) True/false defines whether persistence should be turned on/off
    persistence = ""

    # persistence_time - (Optional) Persistence duration in seconds
    persistence_time = ""

    # health_check_test - (Optional) Can be `TCP` or`ICMP`.
    health_check_test = ""

    # health_check_interval - (Optional) 
    health_check_interval = ""

    # health_check_path - (Optional) 
    health_check_path = ""

    # health_check_path_parser - (Optional) 
    health_check_path_parser = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-monitoring-policy.body:
resource "oneandone_monitoring_policy" "$1" {
    # alert_if - (Required) Condition for the alert to be issued.
    alert_if = ""

    # process - (Required) Process name.
    process = ""

    # email_notification - (Required) If set true email will be sent.
    email_notification = ""

    # alert_if - (Required) Condition for the alert to be issued.
    alert_if = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The protocol of the port. Allowed values are `TCP`, `UDP`, `TCP/UDP`, `ICMP` and `IPSEC`.
    protocol = ""

    # port - (Required) Port number.
    port = ""

    # email_notification - (Required) If set true email will be sent.
    email_notification = ""

    # agent - (Required) Indicates which monitoring type will be used. True: To use this monitoring type, you must install an agent on the server.  False: Monitor a server without installing an agent. Note: If you do not install an agent, you cannot retrieve information such as free hard disk space or ongoing processes.
    agent = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the VPN.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the VPN
    description = ""

    # email - (Optional)  Email address to which notifications monitoring system will send
    email = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-private-network.body:
resource "oneandone_private_network" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the private network
    name = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`.
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the shared storage
    description = ""

    # network_address - (Optional) Network address for the private network
    network_address = ""

    # subnet_mask - (Optional) Subnet mask for the private network
    subnet_mask = ""

    # server_ids - (Optional) List of servers that are to be associated with the private network
    server_ids = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-public-ip.body:
resource "oneandone_public_ip" "$1" {
    # ip_type - (Required) IP type. Can be `IPV4` or `IPV6`
    ip_type = ""

    # reverse_dns - (Optional) 
    reverse_dns = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`.
    datacenter = ""

    # ip_address - (Optional) (Computed) The IP address.
    ip_address = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-server.body:
resource "oneandone_server" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the server.
    name = ""

    # image - (Required) The name of a desired image to be provisioned with the server
    image = ""

    # cores_per_processor - (Optional) Number of cores per processor
    cores_per_processor = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the server
    description = ""

    # firewall_policy_id - (Optional) ID of firewall policy
    firewall_policy_id = ""

    # fixed_instance_size - (Optional) ID of a fixed instance size
    fixed_instance_size = ""

    # hdds - (Optional) List of HDDs. One HDD must be main.
    hdds = ""

    # ip - (Optional) IP address for the server
    ip = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Optional) ID of the load balancer
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # monitoring_policy_id - (Optional) ID of monitoring policy
    monitoring_policy_id = ""

    # password - (Optional) Desired password.
    password = ""

    # ram - (Optional) Size of ram.
    ram = ""

    # ssh_key_path - (Optional) Path to private ssh key
    ssh_key_path = ""

    # ssh_key_public - (Optional) The public key data in OpenSSH authorized_keys format.
    ssh_key_public = ""

    # vcores - (Optional) Number of virtual cores.
    vcores = ""

    # id - (Optional) (Computed) The ID of the attached IP
    id = ""

    # ip - (Optional) (Computed) The IP 
    ip = ""

    # firewall_policy_id - (Optional) (Computed) The attached firewall policy
    firewall_policy_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-server-baremetal.body:
resource "oneandone_baremetal" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the server.
    name = ""

    # image - (Required) The name of a desired image to be provisioned with the server
    image = ""

    # baremetal_model_id - (Required) ID of a baremetal model
    baremetal_model_id = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description of the server
    description = ""

    # firewall_policy_id - (Optional) ID of firewall policy
    firewall_policy_id = ""

    # ip - (Optional) IP address for the server
    ip = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Optional) ID of the load balancer
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # monitoring_policy_id - (Optional) ID of monitoring policy
    monitoring_policy_id = ""

    # password - (Optional) Desired password.
    password = ""

    # ssh_key_path - (Optional) Path to private ssh key
    ssh_key_path = ""

    # ssh_key_public - (Optional) The public key data in OpenSSH authorized_keys format.
    ssh_key_public = ""

    # id - (Optional) (Computed) The ID of the attached IP
    id = ""

    # ip - (Optional) (Computed) The IP
    ip = ""

    # firewall_policy_id - (Optional) (Computed) The attached firewall policy
    firewall_policy_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-shared-storage.body:
resource "oneandone_shared_storage" "$1" {
    # rights - (Required) Access rights to be assigned to the server. Can be `RW` or `R`
    rights = ""

    # id - (Required) ID of the server
    id = ""

    # size - (Required) Size of the shared storage
    size = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the storage
    name = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the shared storage
    description = ""

    # storage_servers - (Optional) List of servers that will have access to the stored storage
    storage_servers = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-ssh_key.body:
resource "oneandone_ssh_key" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the storage
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Description for the ssh key
    description = ""

    # public_key - (Optional) Public key to import. If not given, new SSH key pair will be created and the private key is returned in the response
    public_key = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}

oneandone-resource-vpn.body:
resource "oneandone_vpn" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the VPN
    name = ""

    # datacenter - (Optional) Location of desired 1and1 datacenter. Can be `DE`, `GB`, `US` or `ES`.
    datacenter = ""

    # description - (Optional) 
    description = ""

    # download_path - (Optional) 
    download_path = ""

    # file_name - (Optional) 
    file_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
